summary: H.R. 112, titled the "Farewell to Unnecessary Energy Lifelines Reform Act of 2025" or "FUEL Reform Act," is a bill introduced by Rep. Biggs of Arizona. The legislation proposes the complete repeal of bioenergy subsidy programs administered by the Department of Agriculture. Specifically, it would repeal Title IX of the Farm Security and Rural Investment Act of 2002, effectively ending federal financial support and related programs for bioenergy. The bill has been referred to the Committees on Agriculture, Oversight and Government Reform, and Science, Space, and Technology for consideration.
